#Text=CanadaVOTES : Liberal Dr. Eric Hoskins running in Haldimand — Norfolk
#Text=On October 14 , 2008 , Canadians will be heading to the polls for the federal election .
#Text=Liberal candidate Dr. Eric Hoskins
#Text=is standing for election in the riding of Haldimand — Norfolk .
#Text=Wikinews contacted Dr. Eric Hoskins , to talk about the issues facing Canadians , and what they and their party would do to address them .
#Text=Wikinews is in the process of contacting every candidate , in every riding across the country , no matter their political stripe .
#Text=All interviews are conducted over e-mail , and interviews are published unedited , allowing candidates to impart their full message to our readers , uninterrupted .
#Text=For more information , visit the campaign 's official website , listed below .
#Text=Interview
#Text=Why are you running for political office , why at the federal level , why this party , and why in this riding ?
#Text=I am running for political office because I feel that it is time to change the way we do politics at the federal level .
#Text=We need a bold , courageous vision for the future of our country , one that rises above party politics and speaks to all Canadians .
#Text=I am running in Haldimand-Norfolk because my family 's roots in this riding go back five generations and nearly 150 years .
#Text=I grew up here , and continue to call Simcoe my home .
#Text=I have spent the last twenty years giving a voice to people , families and communities facing challenges , helping them take hold of opportunities and grow strong .
#Text=Now I want to stand up for Haldimand-Norfolk in Ottawa and represent its priorities .
#Text=We need leadership in Haldimand-Norfolk that works for all citizens , finding common ground and seizing every opportunity for advancement of our families , communities and our economy .
#Text=Previous to this campaign , have you been politically involved ?
#Text=How will you apply your previous work/volunteer/life experience to serving your constituents ?
#Text=Political involvement has been an important part of my professional career .
#Text=After completing my studies at McMaster and Oxford universities I found myself drawn to humanitarian work as a doctor in some of the world 's most troubled war zones .
#Text=Upon returning to Canada I spent three years in federal government as the Senior Advisor to Foreign Minister Lloyd Axworthy .
#Text=I now practice medicine and serve as President of War Child , a leading Canadian charity helping children in war zones .
#Text=I have spent the last twenty years advocating for people , families and communities .
#Text=This experience has prepared me to give a voice to the people of Haldimand-Norfolk in Ottawa .
#Text=As you campaign around your riding , it 's likely that some issues are mentioned more often by voters , than other issues .
#Text=What would you say are the three hottest topics this election , in your riding ?
#Text=What would you and your party do to address these issues ?
